subject: GEOG
title: Indigenous Environmental Management Perspectives
description:
This course examines Indigenous knowledge-based approaches to environmental management. The
first part of the course is dedicated to fostering a better understanding of and appreciation for
Indigenous land-based philosophies and ways of knowing from across the Americas. Key differences
between Western and Indigenous approaches to environmental management will also be highlighted.
The second half of the course deals with finding more effective ways of integrating Indigenous land-use
principles and knowledges in the management of Indigenous and non-Indigenous territories in Canada
and worldwide.
